title: What Is My Eyes Only on Snapchat? Complete Guide

steps.title: My Eyes Only works as a private folder for Snaps.
steps.content: My Eyes Only works as a private folder for Snaps. You can choose to move Snaps and Stories from within your Memories into My Eyes Only. To access the My Eyes Only section, you'll need to input the passcode you assigned during setup. Any Snaps in this section can be moved or deleted at any time, as long as you know your passcode. [1] X Research source You can use My Eyes Only to hide sensitive Snaps from prying eyes. No one can access this section unless they're logged into your Snapchat account and they have your My Eyes Only passcode.

steps.title: Tap the Memories icon.
steps.content: Tap the Memories icon. This is the overlapping rectangles on the left of the camera button. Alternatively, swipe up on the screen.

steps.title: Tap and hold on a Snap.
steps.content: Tap and hold on a Snap. This can be any Snap for now; you can delete it later.

steps.title: A pop-up menu will open.
steps.content: A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap More, and then Hide Snap (My Eyes Only).
steps.content: Tap More , and then Hide Snap (My Eyes Only) . On Android, you'll just need to tap Hide .

steps.title: Tap Quick Setup.
steps.content: Tap Quick Setup . You'll be prompted to enter a 4-digit passcode.

steps.title: Enter a passcode.
steps.content: Enter a passcode. Make sure it's a number you'll remember.

steps.title: Tap Continue.
steps.content: Tap Continue . Be sure to acknowledge the warning. If you forget your passcode, resetting it will delete all content in My Eyes Only.

steps.title: Tap Finish.
steps.content: Tap Finish . My Eyes Only is now set up. You can start adding Snaps and Stories to it.

steps.title: Tap the Memories icon.
steps.content: Tap the Memories icon. This is the overlapping rectangles on the left of the camera button. Alternatively, swipe up on the screen.

steps.title: Tap the selection icon in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap the selection icon in the top-right corner. This looks like a checkmark inside of a circle.

steps.title: Select the Snaps and Stories you want to add.
steps.content: Select the Snaps and Stories you want to add. You should see a blue checkmark at the bottom corner of each selection.

steps.title: Tap More, and then Hide Snap (My Eyes Only).
steps.content: Tap More , and then Hide Snap (My Eyes Only) . On Android, you'll just need to tap Hide . If prompted, enter your My Eyes Only passcode. You may need to tap Move to confirm.

steps.title: Set My Eyes Only as default (optional).
steps.content: Set My Eyes Only as default (optional). If you want to automatically save Snaps to My Eyes Only by default, do the following: Tap your profile icon. Tap the cog icon. Scroll down and tap Memories . Toggle on Save to My Eyes Only by Default .

steps.title: Tap the Memories icon.
steps.content: Tap the Memories icon. This is the overlapping rectangles on the left of the camera button. Use this method if you know your current passcode and want to change it to something else. [2] X Research source If you don't know your passcode, you'll need to reset it instead.

steps.title: Tap My Eyes Only.
steps.content: Tap My Eyes Only . This is at the tab at the top. You may need to swipe to find it.

steps.title: Tap Options.
steps.content: Tap Options . This is near the bottom-right corner of the screen, near the backspace icon. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Change Passcode.
steps.content: Tap Change Passcode . This is the first option.

steps.title: Enter your current passcode.
steps.content: Enter your current passcode. If you don't know your passcode, you'll need to reset it.

steps.title: Enter a new passcode twice.
steps.content: Enter a new passcode twice. If you'd rather use an alphanumeric passphrase instead of a 4-digit passcode, tap Use Passphrase at the bottom of the screen instead.

steps.title: Tap Continue.
steps.content: Tap Continue . Be sure to acknowledge the warning. If you forget your passcode, resetting it will delete all content in My Eyes Only.

steps.title: Tap Finish.
steps.content: Tap Finish . Your My Eyes Only passcode has been changed.

steps.title: Tap the Memories icon.
steps.content: Tap the Memories icon. This is the overlapping rectangles on the left of the camera button. Keep in mind that if you reset your passcode, creating a new one will delete all existing Snaps in My Eyes Only.

steps.title: Tap My Eyes Only.
steps.content: Tap My Eyes Only . This is at the tab at the top. You may need to swipe to find it.

steps.title: Tap Options.
steps.content: Tap Options . This is near the bottom-right corner of the screen, near the backspace icon. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Forgot Passcode.
steps.content: Tap Forgot Passcode . This is the second option.

steps.title: Enter your Snapchat password.
steps.content: Enter your Snapchat password. This is the password you use to log into your Snapchat account .

steps.title: Tap Continue.
steps.content: Tap Continue . You may need to check a box that states you acknowledge everything in My Eyes Only will be deleted if you reset your passcode.

steps.title: Enter a new passcode twice.
steps.content: Enter a new passcode twice. If you'd rather use an alphanumeric passphrase instead of a 4-digit passcode, tap Use Passphrase at the bottom of the screen instead.

steps.title: Tap Continue.
steps.content: Tap Continue . Be sure to acknowledge the warning.

steps.title: Tap Finish.
steps.content: Tap Finish . Your My Eyes Only passcode has been reset.
